title: Msas
text: This school is incredible. I had my oldest there when he was in grade school and now my two little ones go there. The principal and staff there are unlike any other school I’ve seen, every staff member knows each and every child. You can tell just by watching the way they interact with the students that they love what they do and they do it compassionately. My 9 year old has dyslexia and learns slowly they have accommodated him so that he’s catching up, and will hopefully be on grade level soon. I have the amazing staff to thank for this!!  My 5 year old gets up every morning excited to go to school, as he has stated he feels safe there and loves his teachers and I have to agree with him. I highly recommend this school if your’re looking for a place where you child won’t just be a number.

title: AMAZING.
text: where do i even start. this is app is AMAZING and i use it for almost anywhere i go! but i have a suggestion (note: this app is already amazing i just came up with this thought myself promise!) anyways so i was thinking, what if google added an option called “Draw Your Route” or something like that (you guys can change it up if you have a better name) but basically the point of the idea is that you can basically draw your route to a destination for example, say you were going from point A to point D but you wanted to pass points B and C but in a specific route you had in mind. the “Draw Your Route” option would allow you to plot your starting point then draw your route then end at your destination or the place you want to go to! hope google sees this but if they don’t idc i still love the app!

title: Great For Navigation
text: I think this app is definitely number one for maps. I can look anywhere as long as I have Wi-Fi and the quality of the images is pretty good as well, unless you zoom in too much. I love to look at glaciers on mountains like the Himalayas or the Cascades. I also like how there are some bike trails you show. Right now as i’m writing this review were covered in 2 feet of snow, so it’s pointless in winter, (unless you get no snow) but in summer it’s pretty useful. It also helps me out with geography, which is a subject I study a lot. Finally I like looking in on river valleys. It’s really easy to scroll down a river valley and see where it leads to. My only suggestion is that you could add the other planets and moons of the solar system (please include Pluto if you do). Anyway this is super great for navigation and definitely deserves 5 stars. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: A lot less friendly
text: Until recently, the G-Maps app was the tool I would be able to quickly use to navigate high traffic areas. Unfortunately the ability to view JUST the map full screen is no longer available it seems. While the newer "features" may be helpful for people who are directionally challenged or not good with maps in general, I have lived in this area for most of my life and do not need to see balloons for where I can locate a spot to get coffee, groceries, find a gas station or anything else. Obviously the option to zoom out and zoom in still exists if you need to pinpoint a place manually but I would prefer to continue using the application without being forced to always see the search and category balloons. Fortunately the web version is cleaner for now, but it's probably only a matter of time before it gets cluttered with the things that I feel detract from the previous usability I had once appreciated and showed to others. Probably have to use alternatives going forward. Take care and be safe out there!

title: New update is not getting it
text:
I have been using Google maps since they have been on cell phones with out any issues. The previous updates always enhanced the app but this last one is annoying:

I can deal with all the new features except now I can not search for places while en route. You used to be able to hit the search button while en route and it would pull up whatever you were looking for. Now when you do that everything is NO RESULTS. I was on my way to a family members house and was looking for a gas station to fill up before I got there and I knew there were some on my way just didn’t know where, but it was NO RESULTS. It was annoying because I didn’t want to miss a turn looking for a gas station when all I had to do in the past was add location on route!!!! 
I would like to continue to use this app cause I am used to it and I liked how easy everything was, but I have to now train myself on Apple Maps, cause if this is not corrected I need to have a backup plan.

title: Will never use another map or directions app.
text:
I have used Google maps for about 6 years now and it is by far the most reliable, up to date, user friendly, location managing, efficient driving tool on the market. It has never failed me and I drove 68,942 miles in 2021 as Google Maps guided my every turn.

So Thank you to Google Maps!……. 
Or do I Thank the Google Map engineers?………. Or maybe just Google, as in the entire platform that IS the Google website?…..… Well really I should give thanks and praise to each and every Google employee there ever was- As long as said employees got their hands wet during the Google Map rollout- Or any such of its updates along the way.
I could possibly appreciate some of those not responsible  for implementing Google Maps if any of those are by chance a close contact or acquaintance of a Google Map developer and somehow or someway made a contribution to G.M. by not getting in the way of their more talented Mappy time counterparts gettin’ on it.
Obviously I will be unable to extend the same amount of Thanks to a Non-Google Mapper and quite possibly it would be a marginally low level of gratitude I have to offer as I don’t owe a nickel to those yet to enhance my life such as G.M. has done.

title: The standard in map apps but still buggy at times
text:
I use Google Maps for everything. I review everywhere I go and have uploaded photos of thousands of places.

Unfortunately, for the past month or two, there has been a bug that prevents me from adding photos to my reviews. When I go to add a photo, it has two sections: the top part, which is supposed to have photos that were taken at the place I’m reviewing, and the bottom part which is all my other photos. The top part has been empty since this bug was introduced. So I can see all of my photos EXCEPT the ones I took at the place I’m reviewing! The only workaround I’ve found is to screenshot my photos, thus removing the location data and making them appear with all the others. But they’re missing out on hundreds of photos of mine because of this bug.

title: Inaccurate GPS
text: I would like to start off with saying that I use Google maps daily for my job to find clients homes, I serve an entire county so sometimes I am in the city and sometimes in the country. I understand having an accurate GPS when I do not have service (or few bars) but lately over the last two weeks, Google maps has been HORRIBLE to use to get to my destination. Frequently it registers my location to be several hundred yards away in a random direction, even if I had been driving on the same road for miles. Within a city, it tries to put me down random roads too soon or too late, or registers me as arriving at my destinations when I’m still several turns away and I’m left to try to figure it out via another app, which means I have to pull off somewhere to safely switch to Apple Maps and not cause an accident... Not sure what happened in the last two weeks, Google maps had been 5 stars in my book before now.

title: In regards to the latest update.
text:
I dislike this new update so much I might revert to Apple Maps. It’s as if Google is trying to reinvent the wheel. I loved this app before this new color scheme and update. I 
strongly dislike the changes. FYI I’m on iOS and I have the new color scheme. It’s much harder to read the map now. Not only is the color in navigation mode worse (the rich blue line for your current route looks too similar to the lighter blue line for alternative routes), the real issue is the traffic display, which no longer shows “green” when the flow is good - it shows nothing at all, like Apple Maps. Now I have to zoom in farther to see whether it’s not showing me any traffic because I’m zoomed out too far, or because there isn’t any. It’s a really poor experience.

The colors are all also all too similar to each other now, making the map very difficult to read compared to before. It’s really stark when you put two identical phones side by side with each other and one is on the new maps.

title: Google Transit Departures Problems
text:
I used to rely on this app mainly for transit departure times (via the handy widget) since I use the bus to get to and from school/work/home, but recently it’s been giving me incorrect info.

Recently, I got out of work and it claimed there was a bus coming in 7-8 minutes, which was just enough time for me to walk to the stop. I got to the bus stop and the bus was not there; I checked the app again and it now told me the next one was in thirty minutes. I didn’t want to wait that long so, after requesting a ride elsewhere, I waited a short ways away from bus stop and watched not one but TWO buses come and go (the next bus was actually coming in just 10-15 minutes, not 30 like the app said); if I had known that, I wouldn’t have gotten an alternate ride.

No idea what the heck happened to make the information in the widget so ridiculously inaccurate, but man is it frustrating…

title: Almost Perfect
text: I really do like this app. Use it all the time even if just for soured limits that may not be posted since I live in a rural area. I’m leaving this short of 5 starts because I also use iTunes and other music apps. I can have the volume set perfectly for the music to come through the car speakers. And when I am also using Google Maps the volume on that is loud call, ear piercing loud. It would be great if instead of just having a mute button for the volume on this app if it could have an independent volume slide. This way I could look and listen to the music at a reasonable level and adjust a map volume. So frustrating when the music volume is right and this is much too loud. And if I hurry up and turn the volume down. Then when the music comes back on, it’s much too soft. PLEASE add a slide volume instead of just a mute..

title: My new 2022 Indian Pursuit Dark Horse
text: When I saw the Challenger first come out I hoped someday there would be a full touring version. Enter the Pursuit.  I wanted one the minute I saw it and Ian Martin was my ticket.  They got ordered up fast and you couldn’t get any more 22’s but Ian put me on the list and kept me appraised weekly and when that was ordered became available by circumstances he put my name on the order.  I was updated regularly and when that beautiful Silver Quartz Smoke Pursuit arrived, I was told I could pick it up the next day.  My 2016 Roadmaster was given great value at trade (thanks Josh) and our deal was done and I’ll be riding in shortly for all of the great parts Ian ordered for me to be put on.  Always feel great coming to Ridenow (Indian) of Peoria, pretty much a weekly visitor since we moved to Arizona thanks to guys like Ian Martin. 👍👍

title: Really dropping the ball!
text: I have so many pins saved in Google maps and was a huge fan of everything Google the last five years but as of 6mos ago the app has been at a steady decline. Now when I search for the address by the label set for saved pin it searches for only the name rather than the actual address. Also, some of my saved pins no longer show up which I heavily rely on to keep track of clients, jobsites, and upcoming inspections. It's ridiculous that I'm now paying to use Google's mediocre services solely because it would take forever to transfer all the data I've input over the last 8yrs. As much as I dislike the ios version of maps it's currently the most reliable in comparison. I mean why do anything if you're not doing it to be the best? You'd think a company as successful as Google would be able to provide a dependable product because consistency is how you retain a person's business for life. Unfortunately I can't delete the app without losing years of data so I'll be routing for their comeback to happen sooner than later.

title: Used to be great
text:
Before this most recent update, this used to be great. I preferred the previous version. I liked having my commute and most frequent travel destinations on the “home page,” so that I could easily select where I’m going. I liked seeing how many miles each route would take, as well as how many minutes for each option. I liked having more than 2 options, since I’m in Suburbia and have several routes I can take, I could see what was the best option given traffic in a given day. I’m not a fan of the Explore option on my home page - if I want to explore, I’ll ask what’s around me. I hear that video ads and auto play videos are soon to be a thing, which is why I stopped using Waze. I am already inundated with advertising on a daily basis, can’t I just drive to work safely without hearing about what else people want me to spend my money on?
Used to be at least a 4 star app, taking it down to 2 due to the updates and impending consumer marketing overload.

title: Greene Eagle Winery
text:
I have been going to the paint and sip classes at Greene Eagle for about two years. My special needs nephew goes with me often. The instructor ,Deb, is so patient and helpful not only with my nephew but with everyone. So far all of the projects have been a lot of fun and I have met some really nice fellow painters. We attend these classes about once a month so I have had a lot of opportunity to sample menu items. Everything has been very good. In fact I always bring a cheese plate home to snack on later. I have tried several of the wines to find out that Black Jack is our favorite. My local grocery also sells Greene Eagle Wine! Mark is usually our bartender sometimes he will do magic tricks for everyone. It’s a 
  Very cool little extra. This is my go to winery. Atmosphere is just right. I’m looking forward to my next paint therapy class!

title: Faster route window pop up every 30 seconds
text:
It is a huge safety hazard to have to click on that window to be able to continue the route during driving. I have never had that before. This must be a new feature I don’t like and can’t be turned off. 
On my last trip this window would pop up and tell me, he found a faster route, and I had to accept or decline otherwise the navigation wouldn’t continue. That means I have to take my eyes of my road to tap that. Especially because many phone are held my a magnet and tapping doesn’t go so well on that. You could knock off the phone and then go look for it. Consider just choosing the faster route instead of asking and waiting for a tap. It would also come on every 30 seconds. So very frequent. It defeats the purpose of this app. I love google maps, but you really need to change this feature. Safety hazard!

title: Best maps app on any platform!
text: This mapping service is far superior than Apple’s built in one. All I see is them playing catch up with iOS 12 compared to the higher rated alternatives, but haven’t been all that reliable. I always use this app for navigation. One issue I’ve had with the app is the offline mode. It’s a fantastic feature to have without cellular or a leftover phone you don’t use anymore. But I hate the fact that you can only download a certain portion of the area you’re around. I could download more areas, but it’s rather a pain always getting a notification saying I need to update each and every one of those areas. I’ve seen other map apps download the whole U.S., and sometimes the whole world. I feel with the best navigation app, it deserves a feature like this. Please make it happen!

title: Great app but could use a small change
text: This app is truly amazing way better than apple maps and anything else, but it could use a change. I wish there was a create a route option.  For example there are routes that people like to take which google will not recognize since they recognize quick routes or routes based on your location, but there should be an option where you can save create a route and adjust where you turn and what streets you take and allow us to be able to save it. There are certain routes where my girlfriend is comfortable taking to get to school, they aren’t busy roads and she likes that and she is most comfortable with those. At times she gets lost she misses a turn or takes the wrong one, which is why I’d like to propose this solution/ add on because I know others have faced something like this. Thank you google

title: Been acting up recently
text: For a few weeks the app has been acting weird and taking me dumb ways to get places. When I go to visit my boyfriend I usually take exit 163 but the last few times it has told me to take some other exit I’ve never taken and for no reason at that, because my normal exit isn’t under construction or backed up. Then when I follow my own directions and take the exit I’m used to, it tells me to make a right and a u turn at the light instead of just making a left. It literally adds on extra things and minutes to my commutes for absolutely no reason. And sometimes it won’t say the exit number, it’ll just say “take exit to wherever” but if there are multiple close by exits it gets confusing. One time it told me to take the exit on the left but there was no exit on the left and the exit number it was referring to was on the right side 💀

title: Sharing maps and saved places
text: I want to use google maps to plan a trip and find places we want to visit. I used to be able to find a place and label it with an icon. For example a restaurant could be marked with a knife and fork icon, while my home could have a house icon. Seems pretty simple. Then I could share the map, with all its pins with my husband, and he could click on the knife and fork to see the restaurant I had marked. If he clicked on it there would be all the relevant info with links about said restaurant. I’m not sure what happened to google maps but all these functions have gone away. I’m able to create a list but every item gets a flag. Those flags are identical and therefore useless. We’re headed to London and between restaurants and museums and sites the share map is useless. It is a giant confusing pin cushion! Why have they taken away simple functions! And then adding to my frustration, there is no support whatsoever from Google. Just a community forum where everyone just commiserates about the same issues. Terrible.

title: Please STOP Changing My Selected Route
text:
I used to enjoy Google Maps until I was driving, and the app asked me to OPT OUT of the route I chose because it found a “faster route” for me. So by the time I had moment to spare away from DRIVING, I tried to cancel the route change, but I was too late. So I missed the route I originally chose at the beginning of my trip and had to pull over to re-navigate myself back on my originally chosen route. 

I tried to look for a setting to opt me out of this feature, but it is not available. I appreciate Google informing me of a faster route, but there are times when I choose a slower route for many different reasons. Most of the available routes are provided when I’m pulling the directions up, so I wish the navigation would stay on the option I ALREADY CHOSE before I started driving! 

Sometimes, I want a change of scenery. Sometimes, I want to take the roads I have always taken. Sometimes, I can’t even drive the speed limit on the “faster” highway because I’m towing a trailer. So when google claimed the highway was a “faster route with a sooner eta” it was false, because there is no option to set my own maximum speed (for example, 55mph in CA where it is required to drive at 55 while towing a trailer).

I would use this app again IF it would navigate me on my SELECTED route, and then ask the user if I would like to change routes to avoid traffic or an accident. Until then, I will have to use the basic Apple Maps provided on my phone.

title: Almost perfect
text:
Having owned just about every major mobile OS of the past decade, I've used practically all navigation apps. Google maps for me is the most reliable (thought sometimes they make mistakes), with the best features. Adding a waypoint (i.e. stop for coffee or gas) and the ability to add destinations based off your calendar or web searches is great albeit a little creepy too 
What sets Google maps apart is the incredible search function. I almost always find what I'm looking for. I'm not taking about a larger store or famous restaurant; I mean small companies that I need to travel to for work. Somewhere next to no one would need to know about. It's that good. My biggest compliment is the lack of speed limits while using the app. I have carplay and I never see speed limits. There's an option to add which is enabled but nothing on my screen. Once fixed it's a 5 star for sure.

title: A BIRDS EYE VIEW!!
text:
Ok GMaps!  I’ve been submitting photos of my local area and reviews on GMaps for couple years.  
27,000+ views for reviewing40+ locations and 1.4 million hits of my 200 photos. 
1.4 million views!  I think that is en excellent number and deserves recognition. I’m not the inky one with numbers in the millions. Your tube pays after a certain amount of hits. So does Instagram etc. I get GMaps is nothing social media per say however. Reaching a million is a milestone that deserves recognition an award a compensation. Something. I love this app I recommend to everyone. I’ve also shown a lot of people that maps isn’t just for directions mileage and planning trips.  There is so much more cool things to do. A person can easily get lost for hours.  The discoveries are endless. 
GMAPS IS EXPLORING ON A WHOLE OTHER LEVEL FROM A BIRDS EYE VIEW!!

title: Add recent trips
text: I love / hate this app. It’s great because of all its features but after a couple uses it goes bad on you. I’ll start my navigation and all of a sudden the arrow that points in the way I’m headed flips on me and shows me in either the opposite direction or that I’m going left or something unhelpful like that. This “feature” or glitch as I would call it, is SUPER ANNOYING and unhelpful because now when I have to make a left or right I have to grab my phone while I’m driving and turn it to see the actual way I’m supposed to be driving or I have to take multiple looks at the screen just to figure out which way I’m supposed to go which is annoying. I have my screen locked so it’s not like the phone is turned sideways or something that the arrow should be turning. Please make it so the app only point forward and not any other way. I love using this app when I first download it because it doesn’t do this then I end up deleting it because it ends up doing this. Thanks!

title: Unnecessary or Missing Navigation Instructions
text:
I’ve used Maps a lot, but lately it has been egregious in plotting navigation routes that take excessive right turns to avoid a route that is shorter but contains a left turn… and though I am familiar with the shorter route (I mainly use GMaps to gauge ETA) if I start taking the shorter route the navigation will freak out and take me on a much longer roundabout turnaround to get me to my destination without taking that left turn.

The navigation also tends to overuse “keep straight” instructions, especially in spots where it is obvious that the driver should continue straight… like on a highway where you need to lane change onto the exit ramp lane.

This has also been a long-time issue, but the nav will also not add in a turn instruction occasionally despite being a full stop sign and obvious turn, though this usually occurs only at specific T intersections from specific directions (usually the “stem” of the T).

title: Never get lost again
text: I am really bad at directions, a lot has to do with my high anxiety levels at times. Especially times when I’m driving to a new place and make a wrong turn and then another wrong turn. Currently I am in the Estate Sale business and am in a new location weekly, and all I have to go on is the address. I have tried different map sites and I swear to you they have gotten me so lost, so many times. I have been late, ready to just turn around and go home In tears because I’m lost. I recently found google maps, I love the satellite feature, and I haven’t been lost ever since! Google maps is awesome I love it, if there is something wrong ahead of me it’ll reroute me and most of the time I don’t even realize it. Google maps gets me to my destination and I can’t live without it...!!! Thank you ....

title: satisfied with the service of everyone involved
text: I just want to say that I had an accident January 11, 2021 ….not knowing what to do i dialed 1411 pain i believe the number is and from that moment, all those lawyers from this law firm contacted me and made me feel reassured that they were going to handle this accident with major priority, and from the first phone call they have did nothing but kept their word ms pier has went above and beyond making sure i understood everything that process calls for me to understand as she has been exceptional with teaching me the dealings behind been injured in a car accident. Hopefully I will never and do another accident but if I do, they will be the only people I call from here on out. I just wanted to thank everyone for their service.

title: Good navigation, bad integration
text:
The navigation is awesome except for a few easily fixable bugs. My only inconvenience is that they integrated the Google Assistant into the app, and it doesn’t exactly work well. The Assistant takes forever to understand your voice, even longer to complete your request, and still only actually completes very simple actions, with major audio breaks in one response. If you’re going to integrate a valuable feature that the company usually is very good with, just try to do it right. 

Also, the other glitch I’ve noticed is location sharing. While on a route, I’ve attempted to share my location with others through messages and they’ve been unsuccessful in seeing my location after being redirected to the Google Maps app after clicking the link I have sent them. 

Keep up the good work and try to fix the bugs.

title: Moved things around - please fix
text:
Hello, why have you moved “Your Places” into Settings (as of April 7, 2023)? Locations that I’ve bookmarked should be easily accessible to me, but instead my lower navigation is filled with buttons that I do not use and did not ask for. I do not need “Go” or “Business” or “Contributions” or “Updates” at all, but certainly not in the lower navigation, taking space away from a button leads to “Your Places.” (As an aside, I also don’t really need “Latest in the area” taking up the lower third of the screen.) Can you please issue an update and fix this, or show us to enable or disable this? I’d appreciate it, thank you

Also, can you issue an update so we can toggle off the layer with our bookmarked places if we choose? Sometimes when I’m looking at search results on the map, I don’t need to also see pins of other bookmarks I’ve made as well. In that moment, I only want to see my search results. Thanks!

title: The Beach House
text:
When we come to Costa Rica the place we always stay is our favorite spot in Manuel Antonio, The Beach House. It truly is “The Beach House”. You will not find a better location on any beach anywhere. You literally wake up, walk outside, jump in the pool, walk thru the trees to the sand and jump in the ocean. Afterwards do that in reverse all day long! It is centrally located to Manual Antonio National Park, with its jungle wildlife, monkeys are daily visitors in your back yard. Restaurants abound and transportation is easily gotten, additionally you can walk next door and there is beach Resturant. They also offer food and drink service to you while laying in the beach. 
The service we get  each time from the people who work and manage The Beach House is World Class. They redefine the true Pura Vida, only found in Costa Rica at The Beach House!

title: Glitchy, works like a beta test.
text:
I don’t know what they’ve done, but the arrow that’s supposed to be me heading in one direction is often pointing to my left as I continue straight.

Also, unlike previous editions, prior to reaching my destination (usually 0.25 miles away), the map often completes the routing and zooms out despite still looking for a specific address. It’s even worse when I’ve entered multiple addresses. As a delivery driver, this is frustrating since the map is often what allows me to get a product to the customer in a timely manner as I can see what their home and yard look like. You wouldn’t believe how many people want a delivery, but continually refuse to mark their homes adequately, if at all. This is why delivery drivers absolutely DEPEND on a quality app experience, and not some quirky bit of garbage. Truly, it’s as if Google Maps took a few steps backward.

title: Absolute garbage
text:
I don't write reviews. This is the most broken, horrible app by a large company that I have ever used. I used it because DoorDash has it as the in-app navigation, and I regret doing so. It literally had me exit the freeway, drive around a neighborhood, and then get back on THE SAME FREEWAY ENTRANCE. At a different on-ramp, it completely reversed the spoken left/directions and forced me to drive an extra fifteen miles between two separate times, wasting work time. In addition to those inexcusable mistakes, it spends a ridiculous amount of time saying unnecessary parts of street names and directions, while still being unable to tell me what's coming up next after a turn unless I'm already right on top of it. It doesn't say things anything close to far enough in advance. Finally, the lack of anything like stop signs or stoplights displayed on the map has me counting turns whenever I'm in the city, hoping I don't miss one.
I used this app for two weeks. I'm embarrassed that I did for that long.

title: Best Art Gallery in Florida
text:
My daughter is an avid artist. She studied it in college as her major and Bible was minor. She went to the Dali Museum and said, “hey momma you have to check this place out he has some interesting and amazing facts about his art and the perception of it. Now of course, she has switched jobs and is now into landscaping which still is a perfect balance of art form. Size, calculations, color amongst many other different details. She never ceases to amaze me of her own free will of art or the dramatic flair. My fiancé and I have booked a date to attend the museum. Guaranteed I or he will not be disappointed. Probably take home a few pieces of His collections maybe: artwork, books, jewelry
or a possible membership as a gift. You never no the blends of art before you. Sincerely, 

Lynne M, from Saint Petersburg, FL
Mia chi babe

title: More screen clutter - REVISED AGAIN APRIL 2021
text:
SECOND UPDATE. Google has decided to again to remove the ability to tap anywhere on the map to remove all the screen clutter. A tap once again just drops a stupid pin. Only way to remove all screen mess is to carefully swipe up on the search bar, but half the time the app thinks I'm tapping the search box instead of swiping up. PLEASE RESTORE THE ONE-TAP SCREEN CLEAR!!!

 UPDATE Google has restored the one tap clear the screen of all menus and buttons so I'm changing my rating back to 5 stars. -----/////// One of the main reasons I'd always preferred Google Maps over Apple Maps was the ability to tap a blank spot on the map to hide the search bar and tab bar, giving me more screen real estate just for the map. This version no longer does that. Tapping the screen just drops a pin now. Thanks for messing up this feature, Google. At least give us a settings option to allow the clearing of all tabs and boxes.

userName: fish B hf guy uh hjj
title: Astonishingly incompetent for common use cases
text:
Google brought us some of the finest software on earth and including cloud technology, voice recognition that (unlike Apple's) actually works, Gmail, Google search. Why, then, is there mapping software so overwhelmingly bad?
Here's a common use case: I start Google Maps, enter destination, and tap start, or tap the microphone button and say, "navigate to someplace".
Rather than just starting reasonable directions, sometimes the software assumes I am on foot or on bicycle, and repeatedly changes and corrects its directions as I drive, changing its mind multiple times per minute, interrupting its own sentences. Hey Google, do you think that maybe, if I am going 70 mph, on a highway, that has no sidewalks, maybe your original gas that I am on foot might be wrong?
Do you think that may be, it is possible to start directions and see that they are fundamentally flawed and allow the user to change their transportation method?

title: Perfect gps
text: Google maps has been the best gps I’ve tried and have continued to use it, one thing people have told me that they enjoy about Apple maps and waze is that those apps have a speed limit placed on the interface itself and that enjoy that feature because speed limit signs aren’t always posted and it’s just another precaution, if google maps could somehow incorporate that feature into their app I believe it would help not only sway more user towards google maps but it could also help prevent accidents for drivers who are assuming the speed limit instead of being sure, it would be a safe but very useful feature to have a speed limit on the screen. I have no problems with speeding but I believe this would really help improve driving and user satisfaction.

userName: Half of a free trial song
title: Not accurate last few days
text:
UPDATE 3-4-22 what the heck google, map is horrible so many unknown pins for restaurants - TOTAL GARBAGE! These are not my PINS just suggested pins from GOOGLE!? I can’t even see the primary and alternative routes on the freaking map for all the extra crap on the screen. This isn’t my first gripe with this extra garbage, GOOGLE JUST MAKING IT OBVIOUS HOW MUCH OF OUR INFO THEY SELL!
G Maps is all advertising for food places, hard to view because it’s all dotted with paid for blue pins. This map used to be the go to when you wanted concise directions but it’s junk now. No saving grace for this crap. Map uses too many turns that end up wasting time with all the stops and recommended routes take you thru too many intersections which tack on extra time. Map often reroutes while you are driving without notifying you that it found a shorter way. Live here in LV and we do have some newer construction but it’s on existing roads and map doesn’t alert you to that and that it will cause additional delays.

title: Construction/UI
text:
This is by far my favorite app for navigation. My only issues with it have been that its routs don't show construction (my area has a road that's been routed one-way for a stretch because of construction) and despite this, Google maps still routs traffic through the one-way street… going the wrong way. Obviously this is very minor as I'm sure it would recalculate the rout once you start the detour, but seeing areas with construction (and knowing it needs to detour) would be a plus.

Other complaint? The bottom "explore places" bar always popping up and loading. While I might use that at some point, for now it's just a screen hog and a distraction that I cannot disable.

Even with these minor annoyances, I cannot really see myself swapping to any other mapping service; there's just too much that Google does right, and usually excellently at that.

title: Yeah, Now on CarPlay, but....
text: I was excited to finally be able to use Google Maps on CarPlay instead of Apple’s Maps app. But I have to say the CarPlay version of Google Maps is not as clean as Apple’s Maps. It is great that Google gives me more advance time to make a turn. Maps was almost dangerously late. One thing Google should add is the speed limit. Both Maps and Waze have this. Choosing destinations is clumsy. Why not have a way to go directly to favorites? The automatic change from daytime to nighttime does not always work. Sometimes for no reason the voice is from the iPhone and not CarPlay.  The volume setting is not consistent. It can be too loud and I change to normal and then soft but still too loud. Now I have it on loudest and it is fine but I keep waiting for it to be painfully loud. The microphone only works sometimes. I suspect that Google will address bugs now that it is on CarPlay. Waze is also buggy and I’m hoping that Google will address bugs there as well.

title: I’d Be Lost Without It 😉
text: Literally be lost without it. I’m a delivery driver for a restaurant that has a very wide delivery zone, even going into very rural and dark areas. What this app provides is the most accurate directions to the home I’m trying to locate. When I’m on the street looking for an address that is in an obscure location or non-existent the arrow on the app will keep moving along with me until I’m exactly where the home is. Last Winter, I couldn’t physically see some of the houses because of the blowing snow and the fact they were 75 to 100 yards off the road or behind trees yet this app located them for me. I’ve tried other apps but none provide the accuracy this one does. Sure it has its little bugs but Google seems to fix them right away but never had any serious issues with it!!

title: Good for simple navigation
text: I use google maps everyday for many things. This week was the first time I needed to use it to plan out and navigate a long drive through some remote areas and it definitely disappointed. I drove from Denver CO to Saskatoon Canada. That is 1,000 miles through some very remote areas of Wyoming and Montana. Before the trip I attempted to find gas stations so I don’t get stuck between towns . Google showed me stations along the route, but only close to my current location. So I couldn’t use it to plan ahead. In Montana, we suddenly hit a dirt road, which we were on for about 50 miles. If we weren’t in an SUV, that would have cost us 3-4 hours in detours. It didn’t know about quite a few gas stations, service areas and truck stops and some that were on the map, weren’t there at all. To summarize, use Google maps in populated areas. Do not trust it for long trips away from major highways and metro areas.

title: Improve Carplay UI
text:
I have a big screen in my car, but most of the in-app navigation is on the right side of the screen while the left has big clunky directions instead of the flat clean design like the phone app. 

The map doesn't show a lot of street names unless I am really zoomed out. Also, touching an alternative route while navigating doesn't seem to work. I have to either cancel the route and start navigation again or start on the alternate route and hope that the app doesn't accidentally redirect me back. Might be helpful if the zoom controls permanently stay on screen.

Overall, it's quite good and I had been waiting for this update since I got my car, I just wish it wasn't so much like Apple Maps. I was hoping things would be more like the way they are in the app.

title: Please consider…
text:
I have faith in the Google development team (no affiliation and no gain) simply because I have seen how far Google has come developing Maps along with other useful programs- there is much to improve. Please consider the following suggestions for higher ratings (from me): 
1. Truck routes (aside from professional, please consider this option for individuals that may need to rent a truck to move items or the life event of moving)
2. Clear exit number/sign for next exit when on highways 
3. More clarity for multiple intersections- some roads are just very confusing and could add substantial time to your original route.
4. Ability for a passenger to report on behalf of driver (many times I would have a passenger that could report a lane closure or object to the mass population but this option is only available sometimes - I understand it may be something to add with caution… since errors can also be reported.
5. More alternative routes or “smart” route where Maps “learns” your usual route and adjust a trip according to slow-downs, accidents, closures, etc.
6. Option to have nearby Indicators for nearest lodging, food, or restrooms near/on route (and warnings when it will cost extra for tolls).
I hope some are already in process but I felt like sharing my opinion and rating.

title: Could use some fixes
text:
I prefer google maps over Apple Maps. Two suggestions to fix are; that in order to raise the volume for the directions, it can ONLY be done when the app is speaking. If you want to make it louder, while there is no voice it raises the volume on my ringer. Tapping the speaker button in the app only mutes and unmutes. It should have an option to lower or raise the volume anytime the app is open not only when directions are being spoken. 

Additionally when selecting or viewing different route option unless you press the previous route on the exact spot it will preview the route. Otherwise it will select whatever you pressed such as another location. Then you have to press the back button and re type in what directions you were looking for.

title: Used to love it
text: I used to love this, and it was my default app. But all of a sudden it gives me no options to avoid highway or tolls. No matter what I do or what role I try and take it puts me on the highway no matter what. Even though often it takes more gas in more time or longer distance, the app doesn’t seem to care. I’ve tried to delete it re-download it updated and there’s nothing that’s been fixing it. I’ve had to resort to using iPhone navigation so that on simple trip so I can avoid the highway when it’s not necessary. Where I live, the highways often take longer, but for some reason the GPS seems to think it’s faster. But when mileage is more important to your job. You have to pick and choose when it isn’t isn’t wise to use the highway. Especially on bad weather days when people around here still want to drive 60 and 70 on a 45 or 50 mile hwy

title: app went down hill big time over years
text: the nerds at google are become some lazy fat cats after enjoying all that money they been making sell out there user base. they are too busy focusing on censoring the internet and making it less fun to actually improve any of the monopolized products that established them. keep getting sent into roadblock construction sites on major highways that millions of people drive on. it is ridiculous how bad and dangerous there app is. also they took out the easy interface to block tolls so now i have to ask google manually to block em every time and forget sometimes... how much is ur cut from sending me on these stupid tolls just to shave off a minute or two of road time!?!? i hope u enjoy and cherish every one of those call girls and illicit substances u guys get from selling out ur users because people are gonna start getting sick of this lack of quality and ur gravy train is gonna run dry one day..... also free Palestine!! and stop supporting israel war crimes!!!!!!!

title: Glitches lately
text: Usually love google maps. However, I feel with the updates lately there have been a lot of glitches.  It’ll either freeze when using the gps, start showing that my car is completely off course when I had been driving on the same road it had told me to, or telling me to head toward a certain street where I have no clue where that street maybe.  I do like being able to make lists of different places to go/ things to do. However, again it’s difficult to update those lists bc it constantly freezes. It doesn’t let you delete places from your list bc it’s constantly freezing which is annoying!!!!  I have to keep going back into the app to unfreeze it. The ones I thought were deleted are still in there. Still going to use it and continue to use the Apple bc I dislike Apple Maps but just wish the glitches would get worked out.

title: If traffic was as unpredictable as they say, then why does the ETA always go up and never down?
text:
Cause if you ever noticed your ETA climbing, ask yourself why that is. It’s because Google maps no longer actually routes you the fastest direction anymore.

I don’t know what they changed in their algorithm, but since they changed it there has been a noticeable uptick in Los Angeles traffic. Everyone I know who uses Google maps has said that it it took a nose dive recently.

In the stupid thing is, whenever you bring this up with support, they always say that traffic is unpredictable and they do the best they can.

The only problem with this, is that if the traffic was truly unpredictable, then why does the ETA always go up, and never down?

It’s because their algorithms VASTLY underestimate traffic. Their algorithms are what is off here. I’ve been using google maps for years and it’s only been in the past several months it’s turned into probably the most frustrating thing I’ve ever had to deal with.

I don’t even want an ETA anymore. It’s useless. Why have an eta if you’re always just going to show up 10 minutes late to everything anyways? 

At what point will the “Traffic is heavier than usual” traffic become normal since it says that every SINGLE time I go anywhere. 

I don’t know what their issue is around Los Angeles but there are tons of reddit posts that are full of people asking why Google Maps has recently crapped their bed.

Waze isn’t much different.

title: THAN YOU NEAL AND TEAM !!
text: THANK YOU NEAL!!!! I cannot thank Neal and his team enough !! They made the selling process super smooth and easy explaining things every step of the way . I could not ask for a better broker and his whole team was truly wonderful . Neal was very informative and and has a very intuitive sense about the market . I listened to his recommendations  and sold my home super fast and for a great price . From Neal to Lindsay and even the escrow team was very responsive to any of my questions and ensured the process went smoothly and quickly.  I hope the new buyer is enjoying the new home as much as I did …and if I ever need to buy or sell a home again I would definitely call Neal and  his team as they are truly AMAZING !!!!! If I could give them 10 stars I would :)) !!

title: Please stop asking for approval!
text: I use Google Maps for work, using it to get to my patient’s houses to do home care. Normally I’m very happy with the app, but suddenly it’s asking me to rate how happy I am with the app at the exact moment I’m arriving... if the address is down the street, fine - I have a chance to memorize the house number before google wants to be rated, but often, the address I’m looking for is immediately on the last turn, so google asks for a rating before it’s even given me the address, leaving me absolutely stuck! I have to pull over so I can go back and look at the exact address I’m looking for. I’m sorry, but rating google at that moment is not my primary interest, but finding the address is! If I rate it at that moment, I’ll give a zero out of sheer frustration! Do I need to use a different app for navigation all the way to my final destination??? Please tell me how to opt out of rating - I want to rate at my own convenience and choice, not google’s!
